jobDescription: Background & Purpose of the JobThe purpose of an Associate Food Scientist is to support product development related work streams for on time and in full delivery of regional innovation, renovation, quality improvement and cost optimization projects. This will involve working with internal R&D; teams, Procurement, Marketing, Brand and Supply Chain, both locally and regionally, as well as external suppliers. The candidate must have a fundamental understanding of formulation principles and have a “hands-on” approach to laboratory scale-up activities, also needs to be able to translate product benefits into consumer relevant visualizations and demonstrations. Cost saving and optimization initiatives, consumer and competitive understanding, and development of demos may also be in scope for the ideal candidateWho You Are & What You’ll DoAs an Associate Food Scientist, you will support specific technical deliverables that are part of different projects run by Technical Project Leaders (TPL) within a broader R&D; team.• You’re a dot connector: The position works in conjunction with broader R&D; teams including: Process Engineers, Packaging Engineers, CTI (Consumer Technical Insights), Microbiology, Material Experts, Data & Digital, Nutrition, Label Compliance and Technical Project Leaders (TPLs).•You love to win, and have fun doing it: . The position also requires external (raw material suppliers) and international (Global Design and Global Discover Teams) communication.• You’re a story teller: The position requires adapting technical information to communicate results with other cross-functional team members including marketing, planning, procurement, customer development as well as others.• You’re a paradox navigator: The position requires application of technical knowledge and scientific methodologies including bench top formulation, experimental design, analytical methods, statistical procedures as well as data analysis.Lead and deliver bench top product development for innovation or renovation projects based on product brief from TPLs. Lead and deliver bench top product optimization, new ingredients or ingredients from new suppliers screening and validation for quality and value improvement projects.Perform, when required, pilot plant trials and all analytical and sensory evaluations of the samplesWeigh out and batch formulations for pilot plant runs/product bench optimizations/samples preparation for showings/cuttings including ingredient organization and inventory management and logistics (FIFO), interfacing with suppliers to order ingredients where necessary.Perform inventory management and logistics of product samples (pilot plant produced or delivered from factories), manage products disposals and ship samples to other Unilever sites globally.Conduct product showings/cuttings with cross-functional teams including the culinary team and CTI.Interpret analytical, testing & showings results and suggest scientifically sound next steps (with appropriate assistance and support).Lead the process of specification creation in SAP PLM from the request to the approved status and create specifications for all new ingredients and new products to be launch.Lead the delivery of Third Party Manufacturing Manual for outsourced product launches.Participate in factory trials for commercialization when required.Identify improved ways of working and simplified processes.Operates according to procedures and ways of working in line with Unilever frameworks, standards, and policies (SHE, SEAC, etc), relevant regulations (i.e. FDA), Good Manufacturing Practices (GMPs) as well as Good Laboratory Practices (GLPs).Adheres to all company policies, programs, rules, regulations, and safety rules.What You’ll Need To SucceedBachelor’s degree in Chemistry, Food Science or related science 0-2 years’ experience in food formulation preferred.
